isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Performance Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 7. Intake Restriction

svcproc.title: 7. Intake Restriction
svcproc.para: To check for restriction in the air intake system likely to cause engine performance problems.

note.para: High intake or exhaust restriction can cause a large amount of black smoke.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para: Inspect the following parts for restriction, damage or incorrect installation:

item.para: Air filter inlet and ducting (includes hood)
Air filter housing, filter element, and gaskets
Air filter restriction indicator or gauge

note.para: Intake restriction should be below 25 in H 2O. When the filter element reaches maximum allowable restriction, the yellow indicator will reach the top of window and automatically lock in this position.

step1.para: Remove air intake restriction indicator or remove line to instrument panel restriction gauge from air filter housing.
Attach test line to tap for air filter housing.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line, do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect line to magnehelic gauge or manometer.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Run engine at high idle, no load.

item.para: If restriction is more than 3.13 kPa (12.5 in H 2O), replace air filter element.
If restriction is more than 3.13 kPa (12.5 in H 2O), and a new filter is in place, check for obstructions in air inlet.
If restriction is less than 3.13 kPa (12.5 in H 2O), continue with Performance Diagnostics.

note.para: An equivalent test, using the instrument mounted restriction indicator, can only be done while operating the engine at full load and rated horsepower. The true maximum air filter restriction for this test is 6.22 kPa (25 in H 2O).

item.para: Clogged air filter element (dust, dirt, or debris)
Plastic bags or other foreign material in air filter inlet
On engines recently repaired, rags or cap plugs may have been left in the intake system.
